Ratings.comment: I actually took CBE 4764 with him; there was no option for 4764 on here. The class was pretty easy, and Dr. Chalmers was quite nice and was (usually) an easy grader. It's the capstone course, and the only graded material was from the main project and the homeworks. The homeworks can be difficult, but that's what TAs are for. Should be an easy A.

Unorganized as hell and just rambles. At the end of the semester he quit grading assignments because he was too lazy and just gave out final grades kind of randomly (not joking). Take the other design professor

The lectures are not enough to understand the concepts. Use the book and prepare for exams using problems similar to his practice exams. Averages are low, so stay near average and you will be fine. Midterms were open book and open notes with a cheat sheet. Final was 6 cheat sheets (12 pages total). Homework was purely completion based.

Dr. Chalmers is one of the worst professors I've had at Ohio State.  He wasn't helpful in lecture or office hours.  HIs main mode of teaching in both of these is writing the solution manual on the board, or showing the solution manual in office hours without any explanation.  He also uses lecture slides for this course from another professor.

Take Tomasko's design class. TAs and Prof were unhelpful. Some TAs were incredibly rude and the prof doesn't do much of anything. Best of luck on these projects and getting anything out of this class.
Guy does not care at all.  Unorganized, rambles on, looks like jay leno.

Lectures directly from the book (almost word for word on examples and such). Just kind of writes things on the board without explaining them as he goes. Homework problems are useless when it comes to doing well on the exam. Overall not a particularly hard class, but if you have other options for a professor I would choose someone else.

All lectures come directly out of the book. Majority of the exam questions also come out of the book either as example problems or as chapter problems. Exams are open book and open note so most of my class printed the solution guide to the book (found online for free) and used that to answer the exam questions.

Lectures for this course were the professor silently copying an example problem from the solution manual onto the blackboard and then waiting for students to copy it into their notes.  I learned nothing from him.  Oh, and I have no idea how he comes up with exam questions; except the ones he pulls from the book. So, buy the solution manual.

Kinetics has been the most dreadful experience because of this guy. He pulls everything off of the book (notes, examples, homework) then is too lazy to make up his own exam, so he just finds one online that hardly correlates to the book (i.e. terminology). I kid you not, the first exam he gave people found online, and screwed our curve.  AVOID HIM.
Many people dropped this class after the first class. I don't know what's the reason. But smart as you, you can figure it out why! Good Luck if you have him.
Great professor. Very good at lecturing and provides great notes. HW is hard but lots of office hours to help out. Exams are straightforward and the averages are normally high.

Dr. Paulson is a great lecturer and I am disappointed I won't have the opportunity to take a class with him again. He might be one of the top professors in the CBE department. Lecture material was straightforward. Homeworks prepared you well for the exams and nothing was too much of a surprise. He was helpful over email and very engaging in class.
One of the best if not the best professor I've had. Really helpful and I learned a great deal from him
Challenging class, but very enjoyable with this instructor.

Professor Reategui as a person is a nice person. He is poor at communicating in lecture as he doesn't annunciate his words very clearly. The TA's grading lacked feedback and had some mistakes. Exams are fair. He goes through example problems similar to exam questions. Notation can be hard to differentiate and often makes mistakes during lecture

I would do anything you can to get a class with Dr.Reategui. He was the nicest and most understanding teacher I have had. He grades tough but it is for the best with his great feedback. The class itself is rather difficult, but he makes it enjoyable and easier to comprehend. My favorite teacher I have had so far!
This guy sucks

Very bad professor. What I "learned" came from the TA's and outside note taking. Lectures only consist of copying down notes that are already available online, no explanations. Mumbles and talks to himself, not good at enunciating. No reason to come to class; just look at the notes online and ask the TA's. Avoid if at all possible.
horrible teaching methods and very boring lecturer. He does not annunciate his words when he speaks, very difficult to understand. Very bad at explaining things.
Dr. Reategui is an excellent teacher. It was a difficult class, but I manage to get a good grade. You have to work hard for a good grade, but worth it.
Dr. Reategui really cares about students and he is very fair. His class is boring sometimes, but transport is math after all. I will take a class with him again.
Reategui seems like a super nice guy but his lectures are so dry. If you have an option to take another prof for Transport 1, please do.

Dr. Reategui didn't seem to like thermo either. He seemed unsure of himself at times. He relied heavily on the resources of a different prof, which wasn't a bad thing, but his quizzes/exams were unpredictable. I don't think he curved (I took it P/F in Spring 2020 due to COVID). I can't say I learned a whole lot, but he tried. Avoid if possible.
